Sentencas: On the basis of the models of various developed high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems, a unified model of hybrid systems is proposed.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances

Sentencas: General expressions for the power output and efficiency of hybrid systems, high-temperature fuel cells such as solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and molten carbonate fuel cells (MCFCs), and heat engines including the Brayton, Otto, Diesel, Atkinson, Braysson, and Carnot engines are, respectively, derived by using the theories of electrochemistry and non-equilibrium thermodynamics.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances

Sentencas: The effects of main irreversible losses existing in real fuel cells and heat engines on the performance of hybrid systems are investigated.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances

Sentencas: The general performance characteristics and optimal operating regions of some of the key parameters of hybrid systems are discussed in detail.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances

Sentencas: A variety of special typical cases are discussed.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances

Sentencas: The important results in the literature can be readily reproduced, and the interesting findings of our study are presented.
Titulo: A unified model of high-temperature fuel-cell heat-engine hybrid systems and analyses of its optimum performances
